Subcommittee on Commerce, Consumer Protection, and Competitiveness

official_title: Prescribing rules relating to the retention by product manufacturers of records on products distributed in commerce.

summary.text: Requires product manufacturers to retain for 25 years all documents and other materials which are reasonably related to product safety and which come within their or their agents' possession, custody, or control, including studies of risks or reports of illnesses or injuries. Requires claimants or parties in product liability actions, or anyone who anticipates being a claimant or party to such an action, to retain all material, documents, and other data that are relevant or may lead to the discovery of evidence relevant to that claim or action. Requires courts to: (1) order the relevant evidence to be conclusively established in a manner adverse to any party that willfully violates this Act; and (2) assess civil penalties and the other party's legal costs against manufacturers who commit such violations. Authorizes courts to establish a rebuttable presumption construing the relevant evidence in a manner adverse to any party who nonwillfully violates this Act.

titles.title: Prescribing rules relating to the retention by product manufacturers of records on products distributed in commerce.
